last_episode_to_air.name: Moving On
last_episode_to_air.overview: Coach Korn and the girls get ready to play the biggest game of their lives.

name: Big Shot
overview: After getting ousted from his job in the NCAA for throwing a chair at a referee, a hothead men’s basketball coach Marvyn Korn must take a job at Westbrook School for Girls, a private all-girls high school, in an effort to redeem what's left of his career and reputation.

seasons.name: Season 2
seasons.overview: Marvyn’s latest plan toward relevance is to get his team broadcast on ESPN and his method is to recruit an unlikely player: Ava, a gutsy beach volleyball phenom whose public tantrum got her ousted from her own sport. Between losing their assistant coach Holly Barrett to a rival school, new friction amongst teammates, a sudden and unexpected proximity to boys, and off-the-court disasters that no one could’ve predicted, this season, the Westbrook Sirens have even more to prove.

tagline: The real drama happens off the court.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.overview: After being ousted from NCAA, a men's basketball coach takes a job at an elite private high school.

episodes.name: The Marvyn Korn Effect
episodes.overview: Marvyn’s attempt to amp up the girls’ practice regimen put him at odds with Westbrook’s faculty.

episodes.name: TCKS
episodes.overview: Marvyn sets his sights on moving the team up to Division Two as his daughter, Emma, arrives in town.

episodes.name: Great in the Living Room
episodes.overview: After Harper's exposé goes viral, Marvyn seeks redemption by trying to recruit a new player.

episodes.name: This Is Our House
episodes.overview: Louise's dad is arrested. Louise and Olive get caught cheating on a test. Marvyn dates again.

episodes.name: Carlsbad Crazies
episodes.overview: Marvyn regresses back to his old ways while defending Louise from an opposing team's harassment. Holly gets a shot at the limelight.

episodes.name: Kalm Korn
episodes.overview: Marvyn's statue resurfaces, and he stops undermining Holly. Emma accidentally throws a party.

episodes.name: Everything to Me
episodes.overview: Marvyn teaches the girls a lesson: never underestimate your opponent. Emma auditions for the play.

episodes.name: Beth MacBeth
episodes.overview: UCSB expresses interest in hiring Marvyn, while his team grows suspicious. Beth Macbeth premieres.

episodes.name: Marvyn's Playbook
episodes.overview: Westbrook is one win away from Division Two, and Carlsbad is suspected of stealing their playbook.

episodes.name: Ava Fever
episodes.overview: Coach Korn brings in a new player that shakes up the dynamic of the Westbrook team.

episodes.name: BOYS!
episodes.overview: Westbrook becomes co-ed, causing a ripple effect for Coach Korn and the Westbrook girls.

episodes.name: Tipoff
episodes.overview: The beginning of the basketball season brings unexpected challenges for Coach Korn and Coach Barrett.

episodes.name: 17 Candles
episodes.overview: Coach Korn tries to plan the perfect day for Emma on her 17th birthday.

episodes.name: Field Day
episodes.overview: As Westbrook's field day approaches, Coach Korn wrestles with the importance of consequences.

episodes.name: It's Going To Be Okay
episodes.overview: A wildfire threatens everyone's lives and livelihoods as people seek refuge in the Westbrook gym.

episodes.name: Playing House
episodes.overview: After discovering that their house has burned down, Coach Korn and Emma move in with Coach Barrett.

episodes.name: Prom!
episodes.overview: Coach Korn, Coach Barrett, and the girls get ready for prom.

episodes.name: Parent Trap
episodes.overview: Coach Korn navigates unexpected personal situations as his team prepares for the big tournament.

episodes.name: Moving On
episodes.overview: Coach Korn and the girls get ready to play the biggest game of their lives.

2.name: Season 2
2.overview: Marvyn’s latest plan toward relevance is to get his team broadcast on ESPN and his method is to recruit an unlikely player: Ava, a gutsy beach volleyball phenom whose public tantrum got her ousted from her own sport. Between losing their assistant coach Holly Barrett to a rival school, new friction amongst teammates, a sudden and unexpected proximity to boys, and off-the-court disasters that no one could’ve predicted, this season, the Westbrook Sirens have even more to prove.
